hints.content: Let's count how many animals step measured $21\text{ cm}$.

One animal, the chipmunk, had a step that measured $\greenE{21}\text{ cm}$  

So, we place $1$ dot over $\greenE{21}$ on the number line.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7f1ba64caf251b74decb004a1f97c0677e35b567)
Now, let's graph the other measurements on the table.

Here is the completed line plot:

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8d8b8598f34191ca806ec2f5da0eba6e80c46493)

question.content:
The forest animals each measured the length of their single step.   They are going to make a line plot of their data. 

Animal | Single step ($\text{cm}$)
:-: | :-: | :-:
Squirrel | $22$
Fox | $28$
Chipmunk | $21$
Skunk | $28$
Badger | $28$

**Graph the measurements from the table on the line plot.**   
*Click above the line plot to make dots for each of the measurements.*

[[â˜ƒ plotter 1]]
